questions.text: Have I loved my sisters/brothers in community sincerely?
Have I rejoiced in the spiritual gifts and roles of others?
Have I spoken charitably or gossiped in community life?
Have I prayed for those who challenge me to love more deeply?
Have I celebrated others’ success without resentment?
Have I loved the marginalized with the heart of Christ?
Have I asked the Lord for a greater capacity to love?
Have I avoided subtle competition or comparison?
Have I reached out to those who are lonely in my community?
Have I expressed gratitude for the goodness of others?
Have I fulfilled my duties in community with care and attention?
Have I embraced the rhythm of prayer, work, and rest faithfully?
Have I offered my tasks as prayer and sacrifice?
Have I avoided excuses for spiritual laziness?
Have I shown up fully present for community activities?
Have I worked quietly and diligently for the common good?
Have I prepared well for liturgy, classes, or apostolic work?
Have I begun and ended my day in prayer?
Have I spent time in spiritual reading and study?
Have I offered my gifts generously, even in hidden tasks?
Have I embraced chastity as a joyful gift, not a burden?
Have I maintained custody of the eyes and purity of thought?
Have I spoken about the body and sexuality with reverence?
Have I nurtured holy friendships grounded in Christ?
Have I guarded my imagination and emotions carefully?
Have I confessed temptations or falls with humility?
Have I fasted with intention for purity and wholeness?
Have I been faithful to my vow in heart and mind?
Have I turned to prayer in moments of struggle?
Have I avoided all media that could lead to impurity?
Have I shown patience with those in community who annoy me?
Have I avoided resentment or bitterness in my interactions?
Have I responded to conflict with gentleness and truth?
Have I asked forgiveness when I’ve reacted with anger?
Have I practiced interior peace in moments of frustration?
Have I allowed space for others' growth and imperfection?
Have I accepted correction with humility and openness?
Have I modeled the patience of Christ in my ministry?
Have I chosen peace over control in disagreements?
Have I been slow to speak and quick to listen?
Have I been generous with my time and attention in community?
Have I held tightly to personal comfort or preferences?
Have I shared joy and kindness in daily life?
Have I helped others without being asked?
Have I seen the needs of others and responded in love?
Have I treated all guests and strangers as Christ?
Have I been gentle with those who are suffering?
Have I encouraged others in their vocation?
Have I spoken kindly, even when it was difficult?
Have I given my heart fully to God and to others?
Have I practiced moderation in food, drink, and speech?
Have I followed the customs and rules of my house with joy?
Have I used technology or entertainment responsibly?
Have I fasted regularly and embraced penance as grace?
Have I spent time in silence and recollection daily?
Have I witnessed to simplicity and detachment?
Have I used free time in a way that renews my vocation?
Have I prioritized prayer over comfort or escape?
Have I avoided indulgence and consumerism?
Have I offered small sacrifices for love of God?
Have I sought recognition or tried to prove myself?
Have I accepted lowly tasks with joy and without complaint?
Have I avoided judging others’ intentions or faults?
Have I served without looking for thanks or attention?
Have I admitted my weaknesses and asked for help?
Have I given glory to God for all success and grace?
Have I followed my superior's decisions with trust?
Have I prayed daily for true humility?
Have I rejoiced in the gifts of others?
Have I placed myself at the service of the community?
